title: Intelligence.Report.Mark.Koernke.2009.01.01-chakra71
description:
Mark Koernke is back on the airwaves and ready to shed light on issues effecting the rights and freedoms of all Americans. Koernke's radio show "The Intelligence Report" will expose the New World Order's plans for global domination. 

Note, the morning 2 hours were replays from 12/31/2008.  I did not include them here. <a href="
http://www.libertytreeradio.4mg.com" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.libertytreeradio.4mg.com</a>
http://www.live365.com/stations/edtheak47
http://www.pbn.4mg.com
http://theintelligencereport.tk
http://themicroeffect.com

Description from Gary on the yahoo group:

Hour 1:
05:30  Long-winded rant by Don on need for training.
22:00  Mark on need for practice and training.
            Mindset most important.
24:00  Anti-armor - death by 1,000 cuts.
            Example: Hezbollah vs. Israel in Lebanon.
28:00  Helmets.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         M1 steel pot. Liners important.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Millions of fiber liners available.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Sweatband for inside helmet.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Fit sweatband, then clip into helmet.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Choice of helmet covers.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Foam inserts for helmets.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Night vision equipment on helmet.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Bill on helmet necessary for rain. Straight sided helmets only useful in desert.
36:00  Maine Military new offerings.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Austrian O.D. ponchos $15
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         AR15 mag pouches $18/dozen
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Wool trigger finger liners $3/pair
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Shells for wool liners $5 ea.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         100 rnd SAW molle pouches 3/$10 good for HK91/M14/FN-FAL 20 rnd mags
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Molle bandolier $4 for AR15 over shoulder pouch for 3 mags
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Immersion heater $150 ea. New in crate. Put in metal garbage can.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Swiss water bladders 2-3 gal.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Shelter halves $8 ea , hardware (poles stakes) $7
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Swedish mittens $36/dozen
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Mitten liners
51:00  Don on night vision.
 
Hour 2:
08:00 - Tip - Equip parkas with:
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Upper left pocket: glove liners
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Lower left pocket: scarf
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Lower right pocket: balaclava
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Right pocket: socks
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Upper right pocket: firestarter, matches in Ziploc bag
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Hanging from sleeves: mittens
 
15:00 - Mike Nesser. NBC: Personal needs & hygiene.
            NUKE ENVIRONMENT:
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Nuclear contamination - use dosimeter
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         www.OISM.org plans for $20 meter
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Brush off contaminated clothing.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Shake dust from scalp. Haircut a good idea.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Wash food containers
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Bury contaminated food
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Vehicles: wipe / brush / scrape off    
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Rear area: full decontam, front: only areas you will touch
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Foxhole or fortified position: scrape off 2-4" soil, check for contam, mark contaminated areas.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Sleep in uncontam area
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Eat in area checked for contam or under shelter
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Shave, shower, relieve yourself in uncontam area
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Drink potable water from covered containers
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Prevailing wind in northern hemisphere is from west to east
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         You should know your distances from any high priority targets
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         (nuke power plant, military bases, air strips, main transportation routes, water purification stations)
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Don't become a casualty because some fool runs you over in a panic
           
            CHEMICAL ENVIRONMENT:
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Note: MOPP = Mission Oriented Protective Posture (chemsuit)
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Gas may be colorless, odorless.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Symptoms may not show for several hours
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Flush eyes with water
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Rinse skin with soap and water
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Decontam with bleach slurry from pool store
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Do not decontam MOPP suits
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Do not get any oil on MOPP suit (mechanics take note)
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Oil holds contaminants
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         If MOPP suit contaminated change within 6 hours
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         If mask has drinking tube:
o        Decontam top of canteen by scraping or with uncontaminated dirt, or else invert, loosen top, squeeze out some water
o        Take out of holder looped around the voicemitter.
o        Insert into top of canteen cap with twisting motion.
o        Then move lever on mask so drinking tube descends to your mouth.
o        Grasp it between teeth.
o        Invert canteen, check for leakage.
o        Blow into tube to pressurize canteen. If there is no resistance, check to see if tube is all the way into coupling.
o        Once canteen is pressurized, water will flow to your mouth.
o        After drinking, decontam canteen, replace tube in mask holder.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         If no drinking tube:
o        close eyes, hold breath, lift mask.
o        Place canteen to lips, THEN open lips, drink.
o        Close lips, lower mask.
o        Clear mask.
o        Decontam top of canteen.
o         Put top back on.
o        If you have M8 paper, touch it to inside of canteen cap to test for contamination. If contam clean with bleach or clean (i.e. uncontam) dirt.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Sleeping in MOPP-4: use buddy system. Buddy checks to see you do not expose your body or suffocate. Sleep under cover and do not sleep on contaminated ground. If you must, cover the ground first.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Shaving: daily if possible to ensure good seal on mask. 25% of personnel shave at a time. Shave under shelter.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Eating, bathing also done in 25% rotation.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Clothing: bring your own, do not assume resupply.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Everyone should have at least 2 MOPP suits per person. One in duffle bag, one in ALICE pack.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Defecation, urination. "Depends" diapers can be used.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Urination for males:
o        Decontam gloves with bleach or clean dirt.
o        Raise jacket by pulling out over trousers.
o        Unfasten trouser fly.
o        Remove gloves.
o        Undo underclothing and urinate.
o        Then decontam exposed skin.
o        Close underclothing, put on gloves, fasten remaining clothing.
o        Watch for chemical poisoning symptoms.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Female urination: as with defecation.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Defecation:
o        Remove LBE, place on clean surface.
o        Decontam gloves.
o        Raise and fold jacket inside out halfway up torso.
o        Lower and fold trousers inside out, lower to knees.
o        Decontam gloves again.
o        Pull shirt sleeves to elbow and remove gloves.
o        Open & lower underclothing and "perform your function" (i.e. defecate).
o        When finished, decontam exposed skin.
o        Raise and close underclothing.
o        Put on gloves.
o        Restore overgarment and trousers.
o        Watch and treat for chemical poisoning symptoms.
45:00  Tip from Mark: for evacuation, carry large size Pampers for children so you can keep moving.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Everybody puts on some sort of diapers when evacuating. Also useful if you get pinned down.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Must drink to avoid dehydration.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Concentrated food tabs / lifeboat rations useful for evacuation.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Evacuation:
o        Relieve yourself BEFORE you don the chemsuit.
o        Put on Depends.
o        Put on rest of gear and chemsuit.
o        Drink water, eat concentrated food.
o        Then put on boots, gloves, mask.
50:00  Mark area as to type of contamination.
            Water storage in advance is critical.
 
Hour 3:
01:00  Ed on chat rooms.
05:00  Don on night vision (NV).
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Generation 1: Walmart may be cheapest. But may have small front lens, gathers less light.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Look for NV with biggest front lens.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         1st generation: be sure you have an illuminator.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         1st gen: may not have resolution to see across 100 meter field.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         NV useful for evasion & escape.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Someone using 3rd gen will be able to sight you first if you have 1st gen.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Lifetime of 1st gen: 1200 hours from new tube. If used, you wonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t know how many hours used.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         There is a device on market that will tell how much time is on tube.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         1st gen up to 25 lines per millimeter (LPM) resolution.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         2nd gen getting rare. Minimum of 2500 hours lifetime.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         2nd gen: starts at 32-35 LPM resolution.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œSuper secondÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ gen: 45-50 LPM.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         With micro channel plate, more LPM means more light amplification.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         3rd gen: Cyanide film on front lens. Film lets more light through, protects microchannel plate.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         3rd gen: minimum of 9000-10000 hours lifetime.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Heavy usage liable to reduce lifetime.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         3rd gen: better ultraviolet sensitivity.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Full moon, non-obstructed vision with 4x gunsight, differentiate between deer and cow:
o        1st gen: 100-125 yards.
o        2nd gen: 300-400 yards.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         No moon, but starry sky:
o        1st gen: 20-40 yards. Under cloudy sky needs illuminator.
o        2nd gen: 100-150 yards.
o        3rd gen: 150-250 yards.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Good illuminator looks like blue match flame. Cheap illuminator looks like glowing cigar in distance. Even infrared illuminator will be discernable by human eye.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         As light levels get lower, image contains more noise. Looks like reflection in pool.
25:00  Video surveillance
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Medical supply boat attacked near Gaza: one Israeli patrol boat with lights to distract, another with no lights that rammed ship.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         No excuse not to deploy inexpensive video cameras around relief vessels to document everything. Entire ship could be outfitted for $200.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Video surveillance cameras are very light sensitive (see in low light).
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Everyone should install cameras for documenting nefarious actions of various agencies.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Waco - feds destroyed all film.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Valuable for intelligence collection and future evaluation.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Record video of military actions.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Helps correct mistakes by documenting them.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Real time recovery of data.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Relief should be by flotilla.
30:00  Thermal imaging.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Images can be downloaded to computer.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Entry level thermal imaging device manufacturerÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s suggested price $5195. Actual retail price $4995.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         This is not a targeting device: it can confirm targets.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Team using starlight scopes plus thermal will be tough to beat.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         With starlight scope, if someone lies down and curls up, they look like a rock.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Entry level will detect up to 305 meters.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Thermal imagers that may be on top of police car or security gate cost ~ $10,000.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Thermal gun sight can go on top of ar-15 but not .308 (recoil). ManufacturerÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s suggested price $11,595. Actual retail $11,495. DonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s price less.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         SP5OB - Spectre Infrared (IR) Thermal Sight. 2 power. Weighs 3 lbs. 12.7ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ long.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Spectre IR manufacturerÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s suggested retail $12,995. Actual retail $11,400. DonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s price less.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Thermal imaging: black background with white representing heated areas. Reversible (white background, black hot).
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Wars keeping demand up for 3rd gen scopes.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Night vision video may include thermal.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Someone is looking at you with a night vision device is going to see anything you use that glows in the dark. This includes illuminated reticles.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Light discipline: if you hold night vision device eyepiece away from your face so your skin is illuminated, enemy with NV can see you.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Illuminated reticles, red dots, can be used depending on threat level. May be effective against scalawags but not well-equipped snipers.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         Clutter on battlefield: the more stuff burning, the harder it is to pick out soldiers. E.g. smudge pots.
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â·         DonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s number: 231-796-8458
51:00  Announcement of new Colonial Marine company commanders in Virginia and North Carolina.
            Richmond militia kicking into high gear in face of Posse Comitatus violations.
